[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Planning Poker System (PPS) defines requirements for collaborative estimation in agile teams.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PPS supports estimation sessions, workflows, and reporting for agile teams.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PPS integrates with Google Sheets, email services, and project management APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PPS provides web-based dashboards for moderators and participants.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PPS operates on desktops and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PPS supports REST APIs for importing and exporting estimation data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PPS ensures secure communication using HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PPS optimizes storage for game histories and user settings.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PPS ensures 24/7 availability with minimal downtime.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PPS supports multilingual interfaces and time zone configuration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PPS links with third-party project management and spreadsheet tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PPS facilitates game creation, estimation workflows, and team performance reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PPS is designed for moderators, participants, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PPS requires internet connectivity and external authentication services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PPS follows web accessibility and security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Google Sheets for importing estimation items.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall send email invitations to participants.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall export game transcripts in HTML and CSV formats.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable moderators to create games and manage items (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow participants to submit, update, and reveal estimates (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall store game transcripts and estimation metrics for reporting (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall support re-estimation of previously estimated items.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for estimation workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process estimate submissions without significant delay.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 15 participants per game.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store game configurations and user settings securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage transcripts and estimation logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with web accessibility standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt all communications (TLS 1.3).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to W3C web standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall provide role-based access control (RBAC).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure nearly always uptime and secure API transactions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verification includes tests for game creation, estimation workflows, and transcript exports.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System architecture, API documentation, and accessibility compliance reports.
[SEC] 5. References: W3C standards, REST APIs, and Google Sheets documentation.
